working_text: African {var} have been admired throughout history for as symbols of {var} and strength. These iconic animals have {var} bodies — in the {var} family, they’re second in size only to {var}— and roars that can be heard from five miles away. An {var} lion’s coat is yellow-gold, and {var} have some light spots that disappear with age. Only {var} lions typically boast manes, the {var} fringe of long hair that encircles their heads.
